description.p: Pithos Notebook is an offline encrypted markdown notebook for Linux. Your notes never leave your machine. AES-256-GCM encryption with PBKDF2 key derivation keeps your data private.

ul.li: AES-256-GCM encryption with PBKDF2 (600k iterations)
Source editor with live HTML preview
Mermaid diagram rendering
Folders, tags, and full-text search
Tabs for working with multiple notes
Named snapshots and version history
Drag-and-drop encrypted image embedding
Export as Markdown or HTML
Daily notes and templates
Dark mode with system theme support

description.p: Bug fixes, security hardening, and export improvements.

ul.li: Fixed double PBKDF2 derivation in cached key path
Fixed async/sync save race condition with generation counter
Passphrase change safety: refuse while save in-flight, vault-first write order
Config write failures now logged instead of silently ignored
Fixed PDF export path resolution for Typst template
Export formats expanded: Markdown, HTML, PDF, Word, LaTeX, EPUB
Passphrase zeroization, undo/redo fix, table off-by-one fix
Removed stale pre-workspace code and unused dependencies

description.p: Major feature release with 12 new features and security hardening.

ul.li: Find and replace with regex toggle and match count
Focus mode, Hemingway mode, and typewriter scrolling
Smart list continuation for bullets, ordered lists, and task lists
Preview themes (Default, Sepia, Solarized) and synchronized scrolling
Auto-hiding header in fullscreen
Wiki-link autocomplete, inline link tooltips, and search operators
Table editing (add rows, columns, auto-align)
Change passphrase with transactional asset re-encryption
Copy as HTML, vault file monitoring, trash auto-purge
Nonce-based CSP, memory zeroization, atomic writes, path traversal prevention
